TopicTitle: I do models but... What now?

Articles.Content:
I recently have been doing some home-made models of vehicles oriented to a WWII style, it's entertaining to make them but after 4 consecutives i just don't know what to do, I made a tank, an SPG, a truck (and it's very own towed AA gun!) and my personal favorite: A flamethrower tank! 

Now that I'm out of ideas i would like to get some suggestions, it can be anything... Except planes, they are really painful to complete and the results are kinda sad ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

While I wait for ideas I will find a way to put images of the completed ones (it's hard now because I'm wrote this whit my cellphone only :T)

![dZD6KQu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/dZD6KQu.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-23T01:01:19Z" title="03/23/2015 01:01  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 23, 2015</time> by Zaryulenko**

How about one (or more of course) of those railway artillery guns?

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Railway_gun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Railway_gun)

There are some neat designs made over the years.

Nice work by the way!

What are they made from?

Scratch-built?

some of my models use only cardboard (a special kind only found on my laptop's box NOT the normal one), or specific kind of hard paper whit a rough side, i cannot remember its traduction to english but is known here as "papel cascarÃƒÂ³n" all of them started from zero (making every part at the moment of its assembly and using lots of hot silicone so it gets a solid foundation)

Now i think i will go for that french 277mm gun, it look cute ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-25T04:58:01Z" title="03/25/2015 04:58  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 25, 2015</time> by Zaryulenko**

A friend of mine used to make paper/cardboard models of planes in his youth.

They were very detailed too.

It's amazing what you can make with "simple" paper/cardboard!

I'm looking forward to your future model!

Just look up papercraft ideas or plans. here is a site with thousands [http://paper-replika.com/index.php?option=com_alphacontent&section=10&Itemid=169](http://paper-replika.com/index.php?option=com_alphacontent&section=10&Itemid=169)

either use them for inspiration or use the plans themselves to make new art ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
You know what, try building without templates. it's a nice challenge.

I thought you meant plastic model kits, but this is from scratch? Wow. I do aircraft models from time to time, but I also get kinda bored, I'd rather go to space than paint pieces and glue them together, it kinda disappoints me that the end product doesn't keep me going, lol

Are you into any WWII themed vehicles, or just the ones that actually existed?

If the former, then some of the [Steel Battalion:](http://static4.gamespot.com/uploads/screen_kubrick/mig/6/7/9/9/2116799-169_steelbattalion_bestbuy_ot_multi_042312.jpg) [Heavy Armor](http://www.gamoholic.net/images/stories/Steel%20Battalion%20Heavy%20Armor/steel-battalion-heavy-armor-xbox-360_15.jpg) [vertical tank](http://8bitplayground.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/Steel_Battalion_Heavy_Armor_Vertical_Tank-550x250.jpg) designs might interest you.

If the latter, hmm... Maybe a V-2?

Now I'm going to respond all your questions

1- 100% of my models were based of my own drawings my favorite was the "Dermond RT", it was supposed to look like a German half-track but endec better than expected even if I failed to make it like it was drawn (also including its towed gun that was too big for the back)

2- I was going to get a Bf-109 kit to make the F4 variant... But I forgot about ordering it

3-I can go whit anything that looks realistic so I liked those mech ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Today after a lazy weekend I decided to complete this little guy, a TS-10

![rYVWXTP.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rYVWXTP.jpg)

Now im Focusing on a Italian design of midget submarine, it's going to be my first naval vehicle and its supposed to be my training for a regular submarine based off the USS X-1. The only thing I fear of these are the rounded sides of them so I hope it doesn't end in a mess like my IL-4 :C

good luck skywalkers ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) and cheers vaporo btw ; )

![Bw0zUkF.png](http://i.imgur.com/Bw0zUkF.png)
